You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SALESFORCE ORDER MANAGEMENT
Managed and Unmanaged RMA Return Orders

You can create managed and unmanaged return merchandise authorization (RMA) return orders in Order Management.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions
NOTE Salesforce D2C Commerce doesn’t include RMA functionality. It can process only simple returns.

Order Management sets the return order lifecycle type when you create a return order. The lifecycle type determines how you process the return order in Order Management.

Managed RMA Return OrderManaged RMA Return Order

Create this return order type using the RMA Return Items flow. Processing for managed RMA return orders is automated using the flow.

Unmanaged RMA Return Order

Create this return order type from the Return Orders page. You must process unmanaged return orders manually.

The table illustrates the main differences between managed and unmanaged RMA return orders. You can associate return orders—both managed and unmanaged—only with managed order summaries.

MANAGED RMA RETURN ORDERS	UNMANAGED RMA RETURN ORDERS


When you complete a managed RMA return order, Order Management:

Creates a change order
Generates a credit memo and initiates a refund
Updates the financial information on the Order Summary and associated objects
Updates the order item quantities on the Order Summary and associated objects

With a managed RMA return order:

You can add and delete the Return Order and Return Order Line Item objects. You can’t directly add or delete the Return Order Item Adjustment or Return Order Item Tax objects.
You can’t change the values in financial fields on any return order objects.
You can change the values in these quantity fields on the Return Order Line Item object:
Quantity Expected (changing the value in this field updates all financial fields)
Quantity Received
Quantity Rejected
Reason for Rejection
You can’t change the value in the Quantity Returned field.
You can move the return order status only from Activated to either Closed or Canceled.

You can enable canReduceShipping to allow RMA return orders to be adjusted throughout the return process. If an item adjustment is added to the shipping, the shipping item status is set to Fulfilled, and the quantity is set to 1. These values remain, even if all items in the Order Summary Delivery Group are ultimately returned.

	

When you submit an unmanaged RMA return order, Order Management:

Creates a change order
Generates a credit memo and initiates a refund
Doesn’t update the financial information on the Order Summary and associated objects
Doesn’t update the order item quantities on the Order Summary and associated objects

With an unmanaged RMA return order:

You can add and delete the Return Order, Return Order Line Item, Return Order Item Adjustment, and Return Order Item Tax objects.
You can change the value in financial fields on all return order objects.
You can change the values in all quantity fields, but changing quantities doesn’t update any financial fields.
You can move the return order from and to any status.

You can enable canReduceShipping to allow RMA return orders to be adjusted throughout the return process. If item adjustment is added to the shipping, the shipping item status is set to Fulfilled, and the quantity is set to 1. These values remain, even if all items in the Order Summary Delivery Group are ultimately returned.

title: Managing Returns in Salesforce Order Management
